articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Newly Built People's Study House
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Newly Built People's Study House
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to the newly built the North Hwanghae Provincial People's Study House.
					 He went round a remote-controlled lecture room, e-reading room and other places inside the study house and its outside for hours to learn in detail about the construction of the house and its technical equipment and operation.
					
					 The house was not only designed well and the best quality was ensured in its construction but is equipped with all facilities to meet its scientific and technological needs, he said, expressing great satisfaction over the fact that the province successfully built the modern house by its own efforts.
					
					 The WPK put up the slogan "Push Back the Frontiers of Latest Science and Technology!" as the rapid development of science and technology is one of the basic matters decisive of the rise and fall of the country, he said, noting that the party spares nothing if it is to disseminate rich scientific and technological knowledge to people and feels greater worth of working in doing so. He called upon all provinces to build modern people's study houses as required by the era of knowledge-based economy.
					
					 He set forth tasks facing the people's study house.
					
					 In order to help the people satisfactorily acquire latest science and technology it is important to adequately provide the house with all sorts of information and, at the same time, establish a perfect system for preserving information, he noted.
					
					  He underlined the need to put the computer network service between the Grand People's Study House and county libraries on a normal footing so as to place reading on a scientific basis as required by visitors to the study house and thus steadily raise the level of their technological knowledge.
					
					 Accompanying him were Kim Ki Nam and Choe Thae Bok, members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Choe Ryong Hae and Kim Phyong Hae, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su, department directors of the NDC, and Pak Thae Dok, chief secretary of the North Hwanghae Provincial Committee of the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Foodstuff Factories
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Foodstuff Factories 
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to foodstuff factories in Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the Jongbangsan Combined Foodstuff Factory. 
					
					 After being briefed on the factory, he went round different places of the factory including confectionary, noodle and bread production processes to learn in detail about its technical equipment and production there. 
					
					 He was greatly pleased to see varieties of foodstuffs being churned out in an endless stream from the clean and tidy worksites equipped with modern foodstuff processing facilities built by factories and enterprises in the Province. 
					
					 Tasting biscuit, he was pleased to learn that the factory laid a solid foundation for providing people with greater quantity of tasty and nutritious foodstuffs. 
					
					 He advanced tasks to be fulfilled by the factory for its management and operation. 
					
					 An important task facing the factory is to keep production going at a high rate and increase the production of foodstuffs suited to the features of the Province for its population, he said, adding:
					
					 It is the will and determination of the party to provide the people with best things.
					
					  He expressed expectation and belief that the employees of the factory would produce more foodstuffs helpful to improving the diet of people. 
					
					 The next leg of his guidance was the Sariwon Essential Foodstuff Factory. 
					
					 He made the rounds of different production processes of the factory including soy sauce and table oil work teams to get familiar in detail with its technological updating and production there. 
					
					 He praised the officials, workers and technicians of the factory for having kept production going at a high rate. 
					
					 As essential foodstuffs are indispensable for people's daily diet, officials, their servants, should always pay primary attention to their production, he stressed. 
					
					 The last leg of his guidance was the Sariwon Jongbang Foodstuff Producers' Cooperative.
					
					 Looking round the process for the production of sliced vegetables preserved in soy sauce, he acquainted himself in detail with technical equipment of the cooperative and production there.
					
					 He praised the producers there for producing varieties of tasty and nutritious subsidiary food.
					
					 He underscored the need for the cooperative to minutely conduct its business activities to produce tasty and nutritious subsidiary food for people by preserving the good tradition of the Korean nation. 
					
					 To boost the production of the above-said vegetables and other subsidiary food is of weighty importance in implementing the behest of President Kim Il Sung that women should be freed from household chores, he said, expressing expectation and conviction that its officials and producers would make a positive contribution to improving people's diet. 
					
					He was accompanied by Kim Ki Nam and Choe Thae Bok, members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Choe Ryong Hae and Kim Phyong Hae, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, and Pak Thae Dok, chief secretary of the North Hwanghae Provincial Committee of the WPK.

articles.title: Open Message to Defense Minister of S. Korea
articles.content:
Open Message to Defense Minister of S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The Korean Peninsula is now standing at the crossroads of war and peace. 
					 The whole world is heading for peace and stability but it is only the Korean Peninsula where the military tension persists amid a vicious cycle of antagonism and jealousy, confrontation and clash. The north-south relations are in the worst phase in the history of division. 
					
					 Koreans, be they in the north and the south, in a political circle or the military, should feel responsibility for the situation quite contrary to the aspiration of the nation and the demand of the times. 
					
					 It is the duty and mission of an army to protect its country and nation from foreign forces' aggression and interference. 
					
					 Aware of this mission, the minister of the People's Armed Forces of the DPRK National Defence Commission Thursday sent the following open message to the minister of Defense of south Korea in connection with the opening of the north-south high-level military talks to defuse the tension on the peninsula: 
					
					 The important proposal for terminating the phase of acute confrontation through wide-ranging dialogue and negotiations is arousing great support and sympathy at home and abroad. 
					
					 It is the unshakable will of the Korean People's Army to fulfill its due mission and duty as an army of the Korean nation to bring about a new phase of detente on the Korean Peninsula and the improvement of the north-south relations for the purpose of carving out a rosy future of independent reunification and peace and prosperity, without being subject to the past.
					
					 As all the items which the south side would like to put on the agenda of the north-south authorities talks are of military nature related to the military authorities of both sides, the north side has a firm stand that high-level military talks should be opened to handle all the pending military issues including those matters and find solutions to them at the talks.
					
					 The message proposed adopting "On clarifying a view on the 'Cheonan' Case and Yonphyong Island Shelling and defusing military tension on the Korean Peninsula" as the agenda of the talks. It also proposed opening the talks in a place both sides deem convenient in the first half of February to be agreed upon and holding preliminary talks in late January for discussing technical matters related to the opening of the full-dress talks and other specific matters.

articles.title: CPRK Denounces S. Korea-Japan Military Nexus
articles.content:
CPRK Denounces S. Korea-Japan Military Nexus
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities' tightened military nexus with Japan came under fire by the Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea Friday.
					 In information bulletin No. 971 the Secretariat denounced the recent talks between the defense ministers of south Korea and Japan in Seoul, in which they discussed tightening military cooperation over non-existent "provocation" by somebody. In particular they agreed to start working consultation for concluding an "agreement on protection of military information" and an "agreement on provision of war supplies". They are aimed at exchange of military information between the south Korean army and the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" and transport and provision of munitions, the bulletin said, adding:
					
					 South Korea seeks to legalize Japan's provision of military information and support needed for a war against the DPRK while Japan intends to lay a springboard for reinvasion of the Korean Peninsula, realize its militarist ambition for territorial expansion and become the "leader" of Asia.
					
					 This military confab was made under the manipulation of the U.S. seeking to speed up the formation of triangular military alliance and intensify the scheme for aggression on the DPRK.
					
					 This military nexus is a dangerous plot for paving a way for the Japanese militarists' reinvasion and igniting a war against the DPRK through triangular military alliance. It is also an intolerable treacherous act of mocking and insulting the Korean nation which has deep grudge against Japan's past crimes.
					
					 The south Korean authorities try to bring the dark clouds of war to this land in collusion with Japan, the sworn enemy of the Korean nation, while persistently turning down the DPRK's proposal for pooling efforts.
					
					 Their sycophancy and treachery are arousing wrath and apprehensions from among the people at home and abroad.

articles.title: AU to Boost Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
AU to Boost Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The member nations of the African Union have long-standing relations with the DPRK and hope to continue boosting them, Chairperson of the Commission of the AU Jean Ping said. He received credentials from Kim Hyok Chol, new permanent representative of the DPRK at the AU, on Jan. 13.
					 He praised the proposal of the DPRK for improving the north-south ties this year. 
					
					 He hoped that the DPRK would make success in its efforts to defuse tension and achieve peace on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Egyptian Businessman Here
articles.content:
Egyptian Businessman Here
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Naguib Sawiris, chairman and CEO of the Orascom Telecom Holding of Egypt, arrived here Friday.

articles.title: Samjiyon Band's New Year Concert Going on
articles.content:
Samjiyon Band's New Year Concert Going on
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The New Year concert by the Samjiyon Band of the Mansudae Art Troupe is going on at the People's Palace of Culture before full house everyday.
					 Its repertoire includes "We Live in the Embrace of the Leader" and "We Think of General" and "Forward to Bring about Innovations."
					
					 Songs like "Today's Changsong", "My Wife" and "Merry Laughter" got three and four encores. The songs dating back to the period of enlightenment and foreign music presented by the band represented a high level of artistic representation.

articles.title: World's Leading Magnesia Clinker Producer to Emerge
articles.content:
World's Leading Magnesia Clinker Producer to Emerge
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- "We are ready not only to satisfactorily meet the domestic demand for quality fireproof materials but export them to many countries desirous of developing metallurgical industry in the future", said Ri Chan Hwa, 49, director general of the Tanchon Area Mining General Bureau of the DPRK, when interviewed by KCNA.
					 Noting that the above-said factory and others are in the process of taking on new looks as the world's leading magnesia clinker producer, he continued:
					
					 The factory is now mass-producing varieties of building-materials by use of dust ores after building an anthracite egg coal production process, tile production process and packing container production process.
					
					 It has established a new production system operating with locally available fuel. It settled the issue of binder, the core issue in producing anthracite egg coal, manufactured modern equipment and put them onto a CNC basis so that production is kept going at a high rate.
					
					 Green building-materials produced by the factory by use of light burned magnesia are being effectively used to prevent global warming in keeping with the worldwide trend of developing low carbon economy, green economy.
					
					 The magnesia clinker industry in the Tanchon area has a very bright prospect of its development as it has rich raw material, favorable conditions provided by a port and is based on a wealth of experience and technology.
					
					 We will steadily boost production and export by effectively operating the new production system, relying on the world's leading magnesite deposit.

articles.title: Signal Successes Reported from Sector of Light Industry
articles.content:
Signal Successes Reported from Sector of Light Industry
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- All efforts are being focused on the development of light industry in the DPRK.
					 The whole society and nation are increasingly concerned for the development of light industry. Officials of the Ministry of Light Industry are busy helping operations at the factories under it alive with the drive for increased production.
					
					 Energetic endeavors are being made by chemical, metal and agricultural sectors to boost the production and supply of raw and other materials required by light industry including synthetic fiber, plastics, essential chemical products, iron and steel, second-stage metal, nonferrous metal products and animal and vegetable raw materials.
					
					 News of the overfulfilment of daily assignments is reported from light industrial factories including the Pyongyang Flour-processing Factory, the Pyongyang Textile Mill and the Pyongyang Daily Necessities Factory.
					
					 Local industrial factories in various parts of the country are keeping production going at a high rate by relying on raw materials found in abundance in their areas and using renewable raw materials and resources.
					
					 A work is making brisk headway across the country to consolidate the natural raw material bases and bases for cultivating crops to be used as raw materials and tap leftovers, by-products and idle materials from factories and enterprises.
					
					 Scientific research institutions are busy introducing to production valuable successes made in the researches into the improvement of the standard of people's living. The textile research institute succeeded in establishing a Korean-style tetron spun rayon fabric production process.

articles.title: Book on Works of Kim Jong Il Off Press
articles.content:
Book on Works of Kim Jong Il Off Press
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- "Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" Vol. 7 (enlarged edition) came off the press. The book comprehensively deals with his works.
					 The book contains 39 works authored by him from October, Juche 63 (1974) to December, Juche 65 (1976). 
					
					 Among them are "On Correctly Understanding the Originality of Kimilsungism" and "Let Us Firmly Defend the Political and Ideological Unity and Purity of the Party Generation after Generation".
					
					 They give perfect answers to the issues of developing the Workers' Party of Korea into the party of President Kim Il Sung and accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche generation after generation. 
					
					 The book also contains the work in which he called for developing the People's Army into the army of the leader and that of the party in name and reality after defining it as the general task for army building to model the whole army on the Juche idea.
					
					 Included in the book are works which clarify the issues of strengthening the party guidance to the rural economy and developing foreign trade. 
					
					 "For Further Developing Our Juche Arts" and "For Raising Ideological and Artistic Values in Creation of Revolutionary Operas" and other works contained in the book indicate ways of bringing about a turn in the arts creation. 
					
					 There are in the book works calling for intensifying education through revolutionary battle sites and revolutionary sites, sprucing Pyongyang and Mt. Kumgang up well and successfully conducting the work in public health, sports and various other fields.

articles.title: S. Korea-Japan Confab for Military Nexus Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korea-Japan Confab for Military Nexus Assailed
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The defense ministers of south Korea and Japan recently had a confab for boosting their military nexus. They agreed to discuss the conclusion of south Korea-Japan "agreement for logistic support".
					 This movement for military tie-up proves that the scheme for U.S.-Japan-south Korea military alliance has entered a very dangerous phase, said Minju Joson, one of the DPRK's major newspapers, Friday. 
					
					 A news analyst of the paper further said:
					
					 It is well-known that the U.S. has long insisted on the establishment of the tripartite military alliance to realize its ambition for rule over whole Korea and the rest of Asia. Military alliance has already been built between the U.S. and south Korea and between the U.S. and Japan. It remains for the U.S. to press south Korea and Japan to form their military alliance.
					
					 In case south Korea and Japan establish the military alliance, there will be emergence of the U.S.-led triangular military alliance, which will evidently disturb peace and stability and increase war danger in the Korean Peninsula and its vicinity.
					
					 The south Korean authorities' scheme to form the military alliance with Japan is a treachery of offering a road for the Japanese reactionaries to stage reinvasion.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should clearly see the aspiration of the nation and stop at once the moves for military tie-up with Japan. They should also come out to the north-south dialogue at an early date, as demanded by the nation.

articles.title: North-South Exchange and Cooperation Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
North-South Exchange and Cooperation Urged in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea urged the "government" to stop barring non-governmental exchange and cooperation between the north and the south.
					 In a commentary on Jan. 17 he blamed the present authorities for escalating the north-south confrontation.
					
					 They have not yet given permission to the request for contact raised by the DLP at the end of last year to have exchange with the Korean Social Democratic Party, the commentary pointed out.
					
					 The north has advanced a series of proposals to have dialogue for detente without being subject to the past since the outset of this year, but the present authorities have turned down them, raising unreasonable preconditions, the commentary charged.
					
					 This is a clear manifestation of the intention to continue the hostile policy towards the north, and it will only raise the tension between the south and the north, it said.

articles.title: S. Korean "Government" Urged to Come out for Dialogue
articles.content:
S. Korean "Government" Urged to Come out for Dialogue
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Jon Hyon Hui, floor spokesperson for the Democratic Party of south Korea, said at a press conference on Monday that now is the time for the "government" to make an official response to the north's proposal for dialogue at least.
					 If the "government" takes a passive approach towards the south-north dialogue, persistently putting up preconditions on it, it will have a lot to lose in terms of both diplomacy and the south-north relations, she added.
					
					 She emphasized that if the "government" turns its face away from the international community's call for giving precedence to dialogue, this will entail a heavy diplomatic burden.

articles.title: Memorial Service for Rev. Mun Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Memorial Service for Rev. Mun Held in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- A memorial service for Rev. Mun Ik Hwan took place in Seoul on Jan. 18 on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of his death.
					 Attending it were the family of the reverend, members of civic and public organizations and personages of different circles, more than 300 in all.
					
					 Kim Sang Gun, chief director of the 70 Million Korean People's Meeting for Embracing National Reunification, and other speakers at the service looked back on the days when Mun visited Pyongyang and conducted vigorous activities for reunification.
					
					 Peace and reunification he wished for so ardently have not yet come true, they said, charging that the south-north relations have been bedeviled due to the present authorities and the reunification movement is being deterred in south Korea.
					
					 They held that all the people should get united to fight against the war-like conservative forces who only seek to maintain their power with dependence on outside forces while turning back on the nation.
					
					 The Koreans should achieve the independent reunification of the country by their concerted efforts, they said.
					
					 Then there was a concert for honoring the memory of Rev. Mun.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Unpopular Policy Failed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Unpopular Policy Failed 
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Civic and social bodies and political parties of south Korea held a ceremony in Seoul on Jan. 17 to declare a week of mourning those Ryongsan evacuees killed by the police indiscriminate crackdown.
					 They included the Korean Confederation of Trade Union, the Society for the Human Rights Movement, the Committee for Probing the Truth about the Ryongsan Tragedy, the Union of Evacuees and the Democratic Labor Party.
					
					 The speakers there said that although it is two years since the occurrence of the tragedy, the truth about the mass-killing is not yet probed and the evacuees are still undergoing pain behind bars for the mere reason that they struggled in demand of their vital rights.
					
					 Recalling that people in Ryongsan are forcibly evacuated due to the reckless redevelopment policy of the authorities and they are left without any shelter, they declared that this bespeaks that the second Ryongsan tragedy may take place. 
					
					 They called on the people of various circles to get united to settle the issue of the Ryongsan tragedy and launch dynamic actions to force the authorities to roll back their redevelopment policy.
					
					 Earlier, the all-people committee for memorial service for the victims of the Ryongsan tragedy was formed. It groups 106 political parties and organizations and individual personages.

articles.title: Struggle for Peace and Prosperity of Korean Peninsula Urged
articles.content:
Struggle for Peace and Prosperity of Korean Peninsula Urged
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea made public a peace declaration on Jan. 18.
					 The declaration said that all the people unanimously hope to turn into sea of peace the West Sea of Korea where military clash and tense situation persist.
					
					 They are now living in suspense due to the danger of a war that may break out at any moment, it said, adding: The very one responsible for such situation is the present "government" which denied the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 It urged the authorities to stop slanders and calumnies and war maneuvers inciting confrontation between compatriots and opt for dialogue and negotiations with the DPRK as soon as possible.
					
					 The way for removing the war crisis and ensuring peace on the Korean Peninsula is to strictly implement the north-south declarations and replace the Armistice Agreement with a peace agreement, it stressed.
					
					 It called upon all Koreans to come out in the struggle for peace and prosperity of the peninsula.

articles.title: DPRK Joint Statement Backed by Brazilian Organization
articles.content:
DPRK Joint Statement Backed by Brazilian Organization
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The Brazil-Korea Friendship Association supported the joint statement of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK.
					 In a statement on Jan. 13 it said that the joint statement evidently proved the sincere efforts made by the DPRK for reconciliation between the north and the south and common prosperity.
					
					 The peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula are the desire of the world peace-loving people, the statement said.

articles.title: Nigerian Organization Supports DPRK's Proposal
articles.content:
Nigerian Organization Supports DPRK's Proposal
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea supported the DPRK's proposal for detente and peace in a statement on Jan. 10.
					 The proposal calls for defusing the confrontation between the north and the south at an early date and removing the danger of a war from the Korean Peninsula to defend peace, said the statement.
					
					 In order to reunify the peninsula it is necessary to respect and implement the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration, put the interests common to the nation above all and create the atmosphere of dialogue and cooperation between the north and the south, the statement added.

articles.title: Worldwide Solidarity with Korean People Called for
articles.content:
Worldwide Solidarity with Korean People Called for
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations of Democratic Congo in their joint statement on Jan. 13 called upon the progressives, political parties and organizations the world over to support the joint statement made by the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK. They also called for extending firm solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle for peace and reunification. They included the Genuine Lumumbist Patriotic Party, the People's Rally for Socialism, the Working Citizens' Association, the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo and the Democratic Congo-DPRK Association for Friendship and Solidarity.
					 The DPRK's proposal for dialogue and negotiations is the timely, fair and broad-minded one, they said, expressing full support and sympathy with it.
					
					 The south Korean authorities, political parties and organizations should immediately respond to the proposal, they urged.
					
					 They demanded that the U.S. do things helpful to creating atmosphere favorable for peace and reunification, not instigating the south Korean authorities to escalate the tension on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: DPRK's Proposal Backed in Bangladesh
articles.content:
DPRK's Proposal Backed in Bangladesh
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Political parties and social bodies in Bangladesh called on the south Korean authorities to accept the important proposal of the DPRK. They also urged south Korea to come out for the earlier dialogue and negotiations. They included the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, the Bangladesh People's League and the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee.
					 In a joint statement on Jan. 14 they fully backed the consistent stand of the Workers' Party of Korea and the government of the DPRK to improve the north-south relations, promote the national reconciliation and unity and open a turning phase of peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula through dialogue and negotiations.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday to Be Celebrated in Sweden
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday to Be Celebrated in Sweden
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- A Swedish preparatory committee was formed in Stockholm on Jan. 14 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the committee at its inaugural ceremony.
					
					 The committee set the days from Jan. 14 to Feb. 16 as celebration period and decided to organize colorful events and issue a special bulletin in the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Printed in Nepal
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Printed in Nepal
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Arpan, a newspaper of Nepal, on Jan. 17 carried the first part of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is a Juche-Type Revolutionary Party Which Inherited the Glorious Tradition of the DIU."

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige palacio de estudio de provincia de Hwanghae del Norte
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige palacio de estudio de provincia de Hwanghae del Norte
						
  Pyongyang, 21 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio en el terreno el Palacio de Estudio del Pueblo de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte, construido nuevamente.
					  Al recorrer durante largo tiempo el interior y el exterior del palacio incluyendo la sala de leccion por control remoto y la de lectura electronica, se entero detalladamente del estado de construccion, equipos tecnicos y operacion.
					
					  Muy complacido de que dicha provincia haya construido magnificamente con las fuerzas propias ese moderno centro de estudio, senalo que este es perfecto tanto en su diseno como en la calidad de la obra y dispone de todos los equipos que satisfacen los requerimientos cientifico-tecnicos.
					
					  Apunto que nuestro partido presento la consigna "!Que conquiste la tecnologia de punta!" porque el desarrollo rapido de la ciencia y la tecnologia es uno de los problemas fundamentales que determina la prosperidad o la ruina del pais.
					
					Enseno que el PTC esta dispuesto a invertir cualquier cantidad de dinero para divulgar al pueblo los conocimientos cientifico-tecnicos avanzados considerandolo como una labor muy valiosa.
					
					  Subrayo que todas las provincias deben construir modernos palacios de estudio del pueblo conforme a la demanda de la era de economia basada en la intelectualidad.
					
					  Y presento las tareas que deben ser cumplidas para la operacion eficiente del palacio.
					
					  Es importante asegurar suficientemente los datos de distintos tipos necesarios al palacio para dar a entender bien a los habitantes las ciencias y las tecnologias de punta y establecer al mismo tiempo el sistema de conservacion de esos datos, destaco.
					
					  Indico que se debe organizar de modo cientifico la lectura conforme a la demanda de los visitantes al palacio normalizando el servicio de Network entre este palacio y las bibliotecas de los distritos, de manera que se incrementen de continuo los conocimientos tecnicos de ellos.
					
					  Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Kim Ki Nam y Choe Thae Bok, miembros del Buro Politico y secretarios del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Choe Ryong Hae y Kim Phyong Hae, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su, jefes de departamento del CDN, y Pak Thae Dok, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hwanghae del Norte.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige fabricas alimentarias en Sariwon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige fabricas alimentarias en Sariwon
Pyongyang, 21 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno las fabricas alimentarias de la ciudad de Sariwon de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte.
					El Dirigente estuvo primero en el Combinado de Alimentos de Jongbangsan.
					
					Tras escuchar las explicaciones, el Dirigente se cercioro del estado de equipos tecnicos y produccion recorriendo varios lugares como procesos productivos de galletas, caramelos, fideos y pan.
					
					Se puso muy contento al ver diversos alimentos que no paran de producir en los talleres limpios donde se instalaron modernos equipos de elaboracion de alimentos hechos en las fabricas y empresas de la provincia.
					
					El probo las galletas producidas en la fabrica y se alegro mucho de que se haya sentado la solida base para suministrar al pueblo mucho mas alimentos sabrosos y nutritivos.
					
					El Dirigente presento las tareas para administrar y operar bien el combinado.
					
					Destaco que la tarea importante es normalizar la produccion en el alto nivel y suministrar al pueblo mucho mas alimentos convenientes a las caracteristicas zonales.
					
					Senalando que el PTC tiene la voluntad y decision de dar lo mejor a nuestro pueblo, expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los empleados del combinado produciran mucho alimentos que contribuyan al mejoramiento de la vida alimentaria del pueblo.
					
					Acto seguido, el Dirigente visito la Fabrica de Alimentos Basicos de Sariwon.
					
					Averiguo en detalles el estado de reconstruccion y produccion recorriendo varios procesos como las brigadas de produccion de salsa de soya y aceite.
					
					Aprecio altamente el hecho de que los funcionarios, los obreros y los tecnicos de la fabrica normalizan la produccion en el alto nivel.
					
					Dijo que los funcionarios, servidores al pueblo, deben prestar siempre la atencion primordial a la produccion de alimentos basicos porque nuestro pueblo los consume todos los dias.
					
					Por ultimo, el estuvo en la Cooperativa de Produccion de Alimentos Jongbang de Sariwon.
					
					Recorriendo el proceso productivo de los alimentos procesados con la pasta y salsa de soya, se informo en detalles del estado de equipos tecnicos y produccion.
					
					Elogio a los productores por producir varios alimentos subsidiarios de buen sabor y alto valor nutricional.
					
					Dijo que la cooperativa debe organizar mejor las gestiones administrativas con la meta de producir para el pueblo los alimentos subsidiarios sabrosos y nutritivos de buena calidad fomentando las excelentes tradiciones de la nacion coreana.
					
					Destaco que producir mucho los alimentos subsidiarios como los procesados con la pasta y salsa de soya tiene mucha importancia en cumplir el legado del Presidente Kim Il Sung de liberar a las mujeres de dificiles faenas hogarenas.
					
					　Expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los funcionarios y productores de la cooperativa haran mucho aporte al mejoramiento de la vida alimentaria del pueblo.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Kim Ki Nam y Choe Thae Bok, miembros del Buro Politico y secretarios del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Choe Ryong Hae y Kim Phyong Hae, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, y Pak Thae Dok, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hwanghae del Norte.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de felicitacion a Nguyen Phu Trong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de felicitacion a Nguyen Phu Trong
Pyongyang, 21 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il envio el dia 19 un mensaje de felicitacion a Nguyen Phu Trong por su eleccion como Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Vietnam.
					La misiva sigue:
					
					Le envio a Vd. mis calidas felicitaciones por la celebracion exitosa del 11o Congreso del Partido Comunista de Vietnam y por la eleccion de Vd. como Secretario General del Comite Central del PCV. 
					
					La eleccion de Vd. a ese cargo significa la expresion de confianza y esperanza cifradas en Vd. por todos los militantes de su partido y el pueblo vietnamita.
					
					Convencido de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre nuestros dos partidos con magnificas tradiciones seguiran desarrollandose favorablemente de acuerdo con el deseo de los pueblos de ambos paises, aprovecho esta oportunidad para formular votos por los grandes exitos en su trabajo responsable para fortalecer el partido y construir Vietnam socialista en prosperidad.

articles.title: Jean Ping desea desarrollar las relaciones con Corea
articles.content:
Jean Ping desea desarrollar las relaciones con Corea
						
Pyongyang, 21 de enero (ATCC) -- Kim Hyok Chol, representante permanente de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ante la Union Africana, presento el dia 13 sus cartas credenciales ante el presidente del Comite de la UA, Jean Ping.
					En la ocasion Jean Ping dijo que las relaciones entre los paises miembros de la UA y Corea tienen larga historia y expreso la esperanza de que estos vinculos sigan desarrollandose.
					
					Aprecio altamente la reciente propuesta de la RPDC para mejorar este ano las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas. 
					
					Deseo exitos en la lucha de Corea por el alivio de tension y la paz en la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: Minju Joson rechaza la cooperacion militar Sur de Corea-Japon
articles.content:
Minju Joson rechaza la cooperacion militar Sur de Corea-Japon
 Pyongyang, 21 de enero (ATCC) -- En las conversaciones sostenidas recientemente, el ministro de Defensa Nacional del Sur de Corea y su homologo japones acordaron firmar el "convenio de asistencia de materiales belicos" entre ambos paises y debatieron otros asuntos para fortalecer el contubernio militar.
					  Esto comprueba que se impulsan en la etapa muy peligrosa las acciones para fabricar la alianza militar tripartita que incluye ademas a EE.UU.
					
					  Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este viernes y continua:
					
					  Ya es conocido que desde hace mucho tiempo, EE.UU. esta enfrascado en establecer la alianza militar tripartita con el Sur de Corea y Japon para realizar su ambicion de dominar a toda Corea y el resto de Asia. 
					
					  Como resultado, se han formado ya la alianza militar EE.UU.-Sur de Corea y la EE.UU.-Japon.
					
					  Lo unico que falta es la alianza Sur de Corea-Japon, la cual impone ese imperio a estas dos partes.
					
					  Cuando el Sur de Corea y Japon establezcan tales relaciones, sera formada perfectamente la alianza militar tripartita que perturbaria la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y su contorno e incrementaria el peligro de guerra.
					
					  Si las autoridades surcoreanas establecen la alianza militar con Japon, cometeria el acto criminal y antinacional de dar a los reaccionarios japoneses las posibilidades de retomar el camino de agresion.
					
					  Ellas deben poner fin ahora mismo al contubernio militar con Japon y acceder cuanto antes al dialogo con el Norte escuchando lo que demanda toda la nacion coreana.
